}} The 'glucose oxidase' enzyme (GOx) () is an oxido-reductase that catalyses
the oxidation of glucose to hydrogen peroxide and D-glucono-Î´-lactone. In cells,
it aids in breaking the sugar down into its metabolites.

Glucose oxidase is widely used for the determination of free glucose in body
fluids (diagnostics), in vegetal raw material, and in the food industry. It also
has many applications in biotechnologies, typically enzyme assays for
biochemistry including biosensors in nanotechnologies. [http://www.interchim.fr/ft/1/12718A.pdf Technical sheet of
Glucose Oxidase], Interchim It is often extracted from [[Aspergillus]]
[[Aspergillus niger|niger]].
